snippet: Echocardiograms, ultrasound pictures of the heart, are an enticing revenue stream for hospitals and physicians because they are painless and have no side effects.
abstract: Medical tests in United States health care system have become opportunities to bring in revenue, particularly because equipment used to perform them has largely become cheaper, smaller and more highly mechanized; wide pricing disparities have results because tests have been uncoupled from actual cost of business (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Echocardiograms, ultrasound pictures of the heart, are an enticing revenue stream for hospitals and physicians because they are painless and have no side effects.

headline.print_headline: The Odd Math of Medical Tests: One Scan, Two Prices, Both High
headline.main: The Odd Math of Medical Tests: One Scan, Two Prices, Both High
